website_summaries.verdict: Soft, eco-friendly diapers that are excellent for babies' sensitive skin.
pros: Parents appreciate the excellent absorbency, lack of chemicals, and eco-friendly design
Many users felt these diapers fit well and kept leaks at bay
We like that they are not likely to cause a reaction for sensitive skin
cons: Some experienced problems with leaks and felt these were not absorbent enough for overnight use

customer_reviews.title: If you love blowouts, these are for you!
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars for being chemical-free, etc. They are very soft diapers. I cannot recommend them due to the fact that they leak every single time my baby poops. Every. Single. Time. I thought maybe I was putting them on the wrong way, not making them tight enough, or they were too big. No. It was not user error. I am done with these diapers after yet another blowout. It isn't worth it. Edit: I just want to add that I ordered these 3 times so I did give them a fair chance.
customer_reviews.author: Elmo

customer_reviews.title: Burns, Leaks, Stinks, and Manufacturer Couldn’t Care Less
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Terrible. The “bamboo” fibers get stuck to any areas of skin the diaper touches, and these diapers leak faster than Pampers, Huggies, Honest Co, Seventh Generation, Earth & Eden, and most any other luxury or inexpensive alternative. Most significantly, these diapers cause burns so bad, a doctor had to prescribe medication to keep the wounds from infection. These diapers contain harmful chemicals, not advertised, and only acknowledged when you contact the manufacturer. The manufacturer takes no responsibility whatsoever, and is completely unresponsive and unhelpful, regarding any concerns brought to their attention. They state that, although they manufacturer and profit from the sale of these diapers, any issue must be resolved by amazon. Absolutely horrid product, and heartless manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: LoveAmazonPrime

customer_reviews.title: Better than other natural diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I've been searching for my favorite natural diaper, and finally found it! Go-figure it is a brand I've never heard of before taking a chance on it based on reviews. And I'm so glad I did! The image I shared is of my 8lb baby in a newborn diaper. Yes, newborn is a tad bigger than other newborn diapers, but they aren't way too big. They don't leak and hold wetness well. They are also super soft and not papery or stiff like other brands. I'm super pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa McClinton

customer_reviews.title: Quality has changed for the worse.
customer_reviews.text: As another customer stated, we loved these daipers before but they have changed for the worse. They leak and the tabs come off too easily. The quality is NOT THE SAME and these daipers are too expensive for what you get now. I am returning these!!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: They Changed the diapers
customer_reviews.text: I used to LOVE andy pandy, I used them for over a year with no issues. I noticed around January 2020 that the diapers changed. The stripes on the front of the diaper where the tabs stick, are now glossy and they absorbency of these new diapers are terrible, they actually leak to the outside of the diapers. I was changing my daughters clothes several times a day because of this. For the price, I no longer think the andy pandy diapers are worth it, if they change back to the old diapers I will continue to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Strong chemical odor in some bags
customer_reviews.text: We loved the first few bags of Andy Pandys we got - soft and comfortable for baby. However, the most recent bag we got has an extremely strong chemical odor coming from the inside of the diaper - we do not want them on our baby's skin!
customer_reviews.author: Faculty

customer_reviews.title: Amazing diapers
customer_reviews.text: These are the best diapers we've tried hands down. They are so soft, absorbent, and just generally absolutely amazing. New parents out there will understand how important having good diapers is. It is a big deal how great these diapers are. We've tried bambo nature (old style and new) and Pampers pure. These diapers are the safest chemical wise, the most eco friendly, and the best performing. They don't feel plastic-y like other diapers and they don't irritate my baby's skin. My only annoyance with them is that the newborn size didn't fit my baby until he hit 8 pounds. But overall great diapers.
customer_reviews.author: J23

customer_reviews.title: I cloth diaper and these are great!
customer_reviews.text: Ive read reviewsand honestly leaks happen, blow outs happen..especially with newborns. If your a first time parent making reviews on diapers, Id hesitate because Im a mommy of 3 and these things are normally. There is no perfect diaper but there are some that work better for others. I am a cloth diapering mommy but we travel sometimes and lugging around 20-30 cloth diapers is redic. So after much research I found these and LOVE them! If it wernt for the price I would consider switching over, but we cannot afford the price tag. We save these for travel and diaper bag outings only. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey

customer_reviews.title: Leaks unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended to me. This is the 2nd time I purchased these. First was the L and then the XL I usually buy honest or 7th Gen. My daughter was a size 4, and from reading reviews, L would be equivalent. Unfortunately she leaked through these a few times, which is why I ordered the XL. By that time she was 27lbs which is the minimum for XL. She again leaked. It's almost too big for her. The legs have gaps. And she actually has big thighs. So it's just not elastic enough. I won't be buying these again. I really wanted to like them since honest makes her a little red but never had an issue with leakage.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Osiadacz

customer_reviews.title: Stringy pulp comes off the diaper
customer_reviews.text: We’ve loved these diapers for along time. But lately they seem to be leaving a stringy pulp on my son. It’s really annoying to clean off of him and he freaks out when we have to. It’s like the inside of the diaper is coming apart a bit. We leave them on him for only a few hours. Otherwise, these diapers are soft and work well.
customer_reviews.author: lex

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers.
customer_reviews.text: Best bamboo diapers ever! I cant afford to use them all day long, so I only use them at night. I was using them for my son and now my daughter; they both drink a bottle before bed. Regular diapers dont last through the night (as my kids are good sleepers), could have tied bigger size, but figured that since they spent in night ones longest, I could get something better for their skin. I tried other brands of bamboo diapers, but they all ended up leaking and leaving skin really wet.
customer_reviews.author: Stranger

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing Change
customer_reviews.text: I used to LOVE Andy Pandy diapers and we’ve been using them exclusively for two years because they’re so great but this most recent purchase is really frustrating. The production has changed and these ones are very flimsy, the tabs rip off easily, and they are not as absorbent. The lack of sturdiness for this size is a huge problem when your baby is moving around so much. If the quality remains this poor, I’ll have to switch brands. This is really disappointing because these were our favorite diapers. I would appreciate some response from the manufacturers regarding the change and whether this is the case permanently and for all sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Just so-so
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my environmentally-conscious daughter to use on our new little granddaughter. The baby was almost 9 lbs at birth, but the newborn size was too big, baggy and leaked. They opinion I got from my daughter was that they would not work for her day-to-day use, but she’d keep them for backup. I’m giving this diaper brand 2 stars because I do think that while these didn’t work for us, biodegradable diapers are still a great concept and these just need a redesign, especially in the sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Reader99

customer_reviews.title: Great product worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very good quality they go up near the belly button higher than regular diapers so blowouts don’t go everywhere usually Good for baby’s who might be a little bit chunky they have more room seem to be more comfortable and creates no rash! Love that it is eco friendly much better than waiting 500 years for 1 huggies to decompose Let’s make this planet better for our children and grandchildren to come! Cons: Not a good diaper for all night they do start to leak through after 6 hours
customer_reviews.author: Jessica & Devin

customer_reviews.title: Leaks galore, and odd sizing
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a more environmentally responsible diaper with a wetness indicator, and was excited to find these. I love the idea of bamboo diapers, though I truly wish they'd invest more in appearing professional or legit (the label has typos/missing word). Also, my infant, born at over 9lbs, was absolutely swimming in their newborn size. At six weeks, we could finally make them work size wise, only to learn that they leak CONSTANTLY. Baby gets wet thighs, and the seat of the diaper itself becomes wet. A total waste unfortunately. I didn't buy these due to issues with sensitive skin, so I can't comment on that....
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite eco friendly diaper right now, best for sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve tried gdiapers, honestCo, Bambo, and Naty, cloth prefolds, all in one cloth and a clothes diaper service over a period of 6 years with 3 babies, and so far AndyPandy this is the family favorite. Best brand for the price for sensitive skin. I would rate this diaper as the same quality as Naty but with a much more reasonable price per diaper. Would be 5 stars all around, but with little boys that climb and run and wrestle you may get an occasional leak. With girls I would foresee no problems. Would recommend for all babies, especially those with sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: I mostly love these diapers
customer_reviews.text: I mostly love these diapers! They are earth friendly, very soft, and only diapers breathable enough to not give my son diaper rash. I tried a lot of diapers - honest, bambo, seventh generation, babyganics, pampers, cloth, but found these to be the best. My only complaint and why I don't give 5 stars is because of the size. They are very wide and while it doesn't seem to bother my son or the effectiveness of the diaper, I am wondering if it will start to inhibit any movement as he is becoming more mobile now. I wish the company would just make them more narrow. If you compare size to other brands you can tell a significant difference.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: Ugh they don’t really work
customer_reviews.text: I used to love these diapers but they must have changed the way they make them. They soak through easily, but don’t wick the moisture away from skin well. They also keep giving my child a wedgie and poop has missed the diaper making a huge mess. I hate to go back to normal diapers because of the environment but these just don’t work well enough to keep using.
customer_reviews.author: Uva mom

customer_reviews.title: So soft no chemical smell but Run small
customer_reviews.text: It’s important to put non toxic things especially diapers on my baby. I really like these diapers they don’t have that yucky smell when they are soiled and they are so soft. What I DONT Like is the rising price and that they seem to run small I bought medium sizes 13-22 pounds my baby is almost 19 lbs and they barely close He sometimes poops through. The tabs are flawed they need to fix that. To be safe just buy bigger.
customer_reviews.author: ANLZ

customer_reviews.title: Great toxin-free diapers—our favorite brand!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both love these diapers and they are our favorite brand thus far. We’ve used pampers, Huggies, seventh generation, earths best, and Honest. These do a great job of holding in all the mess, and the only leaks we had with these were when we didn’t put the elastic parts on correctly. We like that these don’t have many of the toxins of the big brands and also they don’t have the mesh netting which has stuck to our daughters skin on multiple occasions (we were gifted hundreds of pampers/huggies so we use them during the day when she has more diaper changes and they stay on less time). I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: smr

customer_reviews.title: The BEST diapers
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a chemical free diaper and after using the 'named' brands came across these. I wish I had found these sooner. You will first notice how soft they, they don't have a chemical smell like other brands and I have never had a leak, day or night. The two times I have run out and have had to use a commercial brand my baby has come up with a rash or worse which proves to me that these are far superior in quality and lack of chemicals than most of the others. I highly recommend these even though they are more expensive. Don't put chemicals on your precious babies, use these.
customer_reviews.author: Rosey

customer_reviews.title: They REALLY run large
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to find these and took a chance on the newborn diapers after reading other reviews that said they ran a little large. To say these newborn diapers run a little large is like saying Shaquille O’Neal is sort of big. They are incredibly soft, seem fairly absorbent - though they don’t do the magic wicking that the big brands do - and aren’t that much more expensive than some of the big brand “sensitive” diapers, all definitely on the plus side. But unless you have a nine or ten pound newborn (and good on you if you do!), I’d recommend waiting a few months to use these.
customer_reviews.author: SGilbert

customer_reviews.title: Yesss super happy
customer_reviews.text: Super happy to find a good mostly biodegradable daiper. I really wanted to use all natural daipers for my baby and toddler for overnight. After trying multiple brands they all either constantly leaked or were horrible feeling. For awhile I used bamboo nature cause they were so light and soft and the most expensive (so hey they should be good right?) But they again constantly leaked at least 2X. I was fed up. I tried these and with these we will stick! My baby wears the mediums hes 5months old and 14lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Christina P.

customer_reviews.title: The best!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. Actually, the best of the best. Before my daughter was born I purchased every single natural diaper out there. This one was the clear winner!! It is soft, comfy, absorbent and has the wetness indicator which was important when they are breastfeeding especially in those early months. We never ever had a diaper rash with those! She is now two and potty trained except for nap and nighttime so I wish there was a pull-up version..but will continue until we phase out completely.
customer_reviews.author: NJB

customer_reviews.title: Chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for months and have had issues here and there but overall worked well. This last bag smelled horrible of chemicals and I am returning them. I will order one more bag to try but I am very annoyed and worried why this was the case from a "chemical-free" diaper option. Would love the company to comment what this smell is! Sadly we may have to look for an alternative if the second bag needs to be returned too from the very obvious smell.
customer_reviews.author: Emily B

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing diaper!
customer_reviews.text: I tried a variety of environmentally friendly diapers, Eco by Naty - least impressive - I found it leaked, Bambo - good but this wet line in Andy Pandy and the lack of leaks and the softness of the diaper makes it a clear winner. Prior to going more sustainable with my diapers, I used Pampers Pure. That was a great product and this performs better in my view.
customer_reviews.author: HudsonNYC

customer_reviews.title: These diapers are great!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I haven't known about these diapers sooner :( They are great! I was sick and tired of the Kirkland and Huggies smelling like chemicals every time my little one went to the bathroom but I didn't know which diapers to replace them with. After reading some reviews, Andy Pandy was mentioned and I thought I would give them a try. I'm so impressed!!! They are soft and hold a lot and even have the blue line to know when they are wet. I will never go back to other brands and am bummed I waited so long.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella M.

customer_reviews.title: THESE DIAPERS LEAK
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these but within the first day, my 2 moth old had 3 leaky diapers. For context, I use elimination communication and only use diapers as back ups. My daughter doesn't sit in soiled diapers as I change her immediately once I notice or hear that she's soiled them. Imagine my surprise after I hear my child poop, I get up to change her and there is a STAIN on my new mattress!! Prior to this purchase, my daughter has never leaked through a diaper or had a blowout, and I've used both cloth diapers as well as regular disposables. Very disappointed in this product which is sad because they feel soft and fit well... :(
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Keeler

customer_reviews.title: Way too big for a smaller newborn
customer_reviews.text: I'm using disposables for the first month or two then switching to cloth, so I wanted something environmental friendly and chemical free. It's hard for me to give a more accurate review because these diapers are WAY too big for my 8 pound newborn. She blew out the first diaper I put on her and I don't want to take another chance. I bought the big pack and wish I could return them, but I've already opened them and used a couple. I can't use them and I will be starting cloth diapers most likely before they will fit her.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Adore these
customer_reviews.text: By far the best diapers we've tried. They run a bit large (and/or our son has a really skinny butt), but no worries, whatever you get your babe will grow into them and you can order a size smaller if need be. Everything else is just second-rate compared to these diapers, full stop. They've never leaked once, they're soft, they're just what a disposable diaper should be. We mostly cloth diaper, but these are our go-to for overnight and travel (which makes the rather steep cost easier to bear).
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Olson

customer_reviews.title: Best Diapers Ever
customer_reviews.text: We have tried many different brands of diapers, and our usual go-to is Seventh Generation. Lately, my daughter has been leaking through every 3rd diaper or so with the Seventh Generation. We found these and gave them a shot and we are so happy we did. No leaks at all...these things really hold a lot! They're super soft with no plastic, and definitely feel like they're more biodegradable than any other brand. We will continue to buy these going forward until she is potty-trained.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: So glad i decided to get these
customer_reviews.text: I was slightly skeptical about the reviews on this product. We bought these are transitioning diapers for the hospital. My son was 7lbs. Many people complain that they are too big. They are a little big but not too noticeably. You need to fold them anyway to avoid the umbilical cord. These diapers WORK! NO BLOW OUTS at all. NO DIAPER RASH at all. NO LEAKS at all. Love it! The wetness indicator has to get REALLY wet to turn blue but it does work. For the price and quality I highly reccomend
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper!
customer_reviews.text: We primarily use cloth diapers, however we used these when our son was a newborn for the meconium (what is that stuff?!?!) phase, and keep some on had for 'emergencies, trips, and travel'. We were drawn to them because of their biodegradability, and natural materials. They did seem a bit on the big side compared to other newborn sizes but that turns out as a bonus since they grow so fast! The wetness indicator worked great, and we never had any 'blowouts' or leaking issues.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Mixed review
customer_reviews.text: Love the biodegradable feature. They def are gentle on her skin. But they have a smooth surface not good for collecting #2. It was always squirting out the tops and sides and staining her clothes. They need improvement in that regard. Would be better to have a quilted inside like a Pampers or Huggies so young baby #2 doesn't get out. It's very liquidy at that age and the smooth surface makes leaks too easy. Never had any issues with urine.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Absorbing and non irritating to skin.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best dye free, scent free, scratch free and super absorbent (I have tried several hypoallergenic diapers and these am very very little leaks and only after a full night a pee topped of with a big wet poop). These are the only diapers that keep my twin girls butt from breaking out. My boy twin is bigger but they both fit perfectly into these diapers. I just love them. My only issue is cost with how many diapers I go through a week lol.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Best Diapers
customer_reviews.text: If you don't want to do cloth diapers because of the work, use these. They do not irritate our babies skin and they make us feel a little less bad for disposing of diapers rather than washing. We have tried all of the major diaper brands, and most contribute to diaper rash. These don't. Definitely worth the price. If you are looking for a great baby shower gift or helping a mom, this is an amazing item. If you are a mom and can afford the steep price, these are definitely amazing. Another option, is to use cloth diapers during the day, and these at night. (Our typical process which helps keep the cost down)
customer_reviews.author: samh

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I have been meaning to write a review on these for a while. I got these at my baby shower and out of allll the diapers we got, (pampers, Huggies, honest) these are by far the best. They’re so buttery soft and thick! They don’t leak despite other reviews? Just make sure the ruffles are out on the legs. Other diapers are thin and feel plasticy and full of gel. The newborn size is a bit big so I used as size ones. Other than that I won’t use anything else for my daughter anymore. She’s in 3’s now and medium is perfect size. Also They’re chemical free and biodegradable!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Van De Car

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers, but price keeps increasing
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love these diapers -- they're soft, hold a lot so are great overnight, and do a good job of wicking moisture away from baby's skin. The only downside is the price. This was my third time buying medium, and it has increased in price each time I've bought it. The first time it was 36.70, the second time 38.70, and now it's a whopping 40.70, over a 10% increase in less than 3 months. If the price continues to increase at this rate, we're going to have to find another brand.
customer_reviews.author: faelight

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with size and quality
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how these diapers gathered so many good reviews. I ordered N size for my average newborn and they were huge for her, so I put them on the side hoping to use them once she will gain more weight. After some time passed we started to use these diapers and every second diaper had tabs problems, it would not stick properly. Also, each time no matter how much she pees or poops it leaks. I’m giving 2 stars only for being clean and biodegradable.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several eco friendly brands (honest company, babyganjcs, seventh generation) and these are the best. They are super soft (which the others are not) and absorbent, good side protection from leaks, and the wet indicator is helpful. I'd give 4.5 stars if I could because they don't have a back flap to prevent poo from shooting up the back and I've also noticed that when they are VERY full the diaper itself is a little wet (but not enough to soak clothes). These are the only diapers we will use from now on. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Works great and environmentally friendly!
customer_reviews.text: Note: even the smallest size is a little too big for newborns, it may be best to use a different brand for the first month or so. We've used other diaper brands, such as pampers and the amazon brand, and these prevent blowouts the best of any of them. They are super absorbent, usually very well contained, and comfortable. We had issues with diaper rash, but if you use cream every time you should be fine. Overall really quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Teddy

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 3 different diaper brands, including Andy Pandy, to use for my newborn. This is my favorite out of the 3 (the other 2 were Bambo Nature and Babyganics). My baby is 3 weeks old as of the date of this review. These absorb well and I have not experienced leaks at this point. The only drawbacks at this point are 2: I have to be careful opening the tabs sometimes or else they seem to want to rip off; the newborn size is a bit big for a brand newborn, but by 2 weeks old she fit it fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. R

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Love these diapers, best of all I’ve tried and I’m sticking with them. It’s hard to find what they are but of exactly, but it doesn’t seem that they have any plastic lining at all, which is great of course, so it makes me feel a little better about using disposables at times.
customer_reviews.author: I. Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: No more diaper rash!
customer_reviews.text: Really really like these diapers! We were running low on our pampers so I bought these after doing some research. In the meantime my husband bought a small bag of pampers (per my request) until these came and they gave my son a diaper rash. Once I switch over to these, his rash went away. I haven’t had any issues with leaks and I love that they are natural. Will absolutely be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the same diapers
customer_reviews.text: We have been getting these diapers mostly regularly but recently have noticed that they are causing itching and rashes on my son. Also that don’t hold up well to leaks anymore. I am very sad as these were definitely our go to diapers! Now that we are having our second baby we were so sure were going to continue using these but now we are not sure anymore as the quality of this product is clearly not the same :(
customer_reviews.author: Hello World

customer_reviews.title: Awesome diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about these. They’re extremely soft and absorbent, and the ph line is a great addition. I’m switching to cloth diapers and the daycare doesn’t do them so I’m having them use these, they’re the most natural I could find. They work great overnight and I haven’t had any blow outs! And she’s had some big poops in them too haha. I will only be buying these from now on, truly a good diaper. If I had a complaint it would just be the sticky parts that close the diaper, they’re a bit gimmicky sometimes but it’s nothing too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Great natural diapers
customer_reviews.text: Love these diapers for our sensitive babies' skin. These are a little bulky (a tad thicker than honest diapers), however they are super soft & do their job well. We use these at naptime & bedtime to prevent leakage for our toddler, then use Earth & Eden during the day as we don't have a ton of money to spend on diapers with 2 kids, otherwise I'd only buy these! These feel like super soft cloth on the inside & are soft and not scratchy at all on the outside. These last through the night no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Reiser

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are the BEST! I can count the number of blowouts our baby has had in 5 months on one hand. They are incredibly absorbent; we can go 10-12 hours overnight without leaks. Softness feels like cloth. We've never had a hint of diaper rash. Amazing company and product. One improvement I would suggest is with the tabs but they work fine and the diaper overall is incomparable to others, ESPECIALLY eco-friendly brands.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Indicator not working not entirely leak proof
customer_reviews.text: These have been good up until a recent order I received. A recent package I recieved has a bunch of diapers where the indicators aren't working. My baby's diaper has been full of poop several times and the line hasn't turn blue. Also, the bigger my baby gets the less these diapers become leak proof.
customer_reviews.author: brittany

customer_reviews.title: Best ecofriendly diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate description. Super soft like a premium diaper. Feel is similar to Pampers but without all the horrible chemicals and fragrances. Few things match up to the reviews... this is one of them. I have tried 10 different ecofriendly diapers and this is my favorite. Only thing is they are cheaper through product website(like 50% of what I paid through Amazon).
customer_reviews.author: Gibby Girl

customer_reviews.title: No leaks what so ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was so hesitant to buy these, baby had a diaper rash and had to use stronger diaper cream so I had to stop cloth diapering for a bit, these are awesome! No leaks at all, there were a few times where once I changed him I saw he could of had a blow out but the gussets and back elastic stopped anything from coming out!! Loved these and would highly recommend!! Loved that the didn’t have a scent to them either no chemical smell or fragrance.
customer_reviews.author: Lcgalvan

customer_reviews.title: Quality has dropped!
customer_reviews.text: We've ordered hundreds of these diapers. With our most recent order, there was a terrible chemical smell, and the quality has dropped significantly. The diapers are now less soft (less like cloth) and more stiff (like paper or plastic). Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kauffman

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper but sizing kinda off
customer_reviews.text: I love these diapers. They are so soft, and super absorbent. The only thing is that the sizing is completely off. I ordered newborn for my daughter after doing some research to find biodegradable diapers, the week we got home from the hospital. She is 13lbs now and fits in the newborn size. So I guess if you order these just order a size down from what you normally would put on your child. She is a size 1 in honest diapers but fits newborn size for Andy Pandy. She sleeps about 6 hours through the night, and the diaper lasts her through the night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: These diapers do not fit as well as or hold urine as well as massive commercial brands like Pampers. That said, there are other things in life that matter a lot to me and these are a good compromise. I've tried most of the common eco diaper brands and these are my second favorite. They're soft, fit fairly well and are absorbant. But they do get soggy and leaky a little faster than many diapers. In terms of the ethics of the company and the materials used these appear to be a great choice. So overall they are worth it and I will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: The best on the market bar none
customer_reviews.text: We’ll never use a diaper from any other company. These are 100% the best on the market bar none. Yes they are more expensive than cheap plastic diapers, and we’re fortunate and lucky to be able to afford them, but they are so soft, fit well, we’ll made, and good for the environment, and have a perfectly working moisture line, we are loyal for life.
customer_reviews.author: DKDC

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN CHINA!!! DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband ordered these diapers just looking at the reviews. I would not put on diapers on my baby or give her baby foods (yes, check your labels) made in china because of all the chemicals these have added. We usually buy Bamboo brand made in Denmark and come out cheaper if you do subscribe and save. Giving 5 stars so that more people will read this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leakage!
customer_reviews.text: My baby is 4 weeks old and we are on pack #4 or the size smalls. These diapers leak from the sides. I do laundry sooooo often because of these diapers. Not only do they leak out the sides but when it's full of pee it tends to be damp to the touch and gets the clothes damp. So at night time if she sleeps a longs stretch, I know that I'm going to have to do a whole outfit change because of these diapers. Sorry, I really wanted to like these!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah H.

customer_reviews.title: won't hold up overnight for a tossing and turning toddler
customer_reviews.text: These worked great until our 1 year old started to toss, turn and sleep walk. Somehow they shift and she pees out the side. No matter how much care I put into putting them on "correctly". Also, If I put her in her hiking backpack, they sometimes shift and slide to the side and she pees out the side during the day. If they were to stay in place they'd hold a lot of liquid. Just as much as a pampers or huggies brand. I like that they are biodegradable. Other than that there are not of much use to us anymore now that she is a toddler and active.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: Not very good for overnight
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like the diapers as always try to get the most eco friendly and also good for people products. However, when using as overnight I found my child covered in some kind of crystallized urine ( i'm guessing). It was coming out of the diaper in small chunks that can be grabbed by children easily; not very safe. it works well when changing frequent, not for overnight, and run small. Not buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Naddy2.0

customer_reviews.title: Best Diapers on the Market
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the only diapers I buy now. I wish they had 30 packs for when you need just a few between subscribe and save deliveries, but other than that they work so well. I've had zero issues with diaper rash, redness or irritation. As for absorbency they are also stellar. I've had zero leaks - especially on those post immunization days when you don't know what to expect. I just love this product and hope the brand gets better and better while staying true to their formula and commitment of providing high quality, eco-friendly products. I also love the softness of the bamboo.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Queen

customer_reviews.title: Not good for older babies/overnights
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 16 months old, we usually use Poof Biodegradable diapers but they were out of her size so I picked up these Andy Pandy. They are not cheap.... like almost .60 a diaper. They work fine if you are in the position to change your kid every 2 hours but for overnights or the a longer flight they are useless. The pee actively seeps through. Didn't work for us, wont buy again.
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: No Leaks! Follow the size chart
customer_reviews.text: Love how soft they are! So far, no leaks and we are on our second package. We normally cloth diaper, but use disposables when traveling. We have used Bambo, Honest Co, Pampers, Huggies, and Kirkland and while I prefer cloth, these would be my second choice. I like that they are as environmentally responsible as a disposable diaper can be. My kiddo is 28lbs, 35" and we ordered the large. They fit a bit on the big side but I suspect the mediums would be too small. UPDATE: At 34lbs the larges are too small and show his butt check so I think the sizing is pretty spot on.
customer_reviews.author: kdoug

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit infant skinnier than one in product picture!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to use until our infant fit comfortably in cloth diapers (born 7 lbs. 1.2 oz.), but he didn't fit into these until he was about a month and a half old, and at that point he was almost too long for them to fit (22.5 inches). We did use them, but they had a tendency to leak because of the weird fit. Point is unless your newborn is short and chubby, they'll be swimming in these diapers. Pros: Color-change stripe, Eco-friendly material Cons: Weird sizing, leaks at leg gussets on slender kids, pretty pricey compared to other options
customer_reviews.author: Evan H

customer_reviews.title: Love these diapers!
customer_reviews.text: My friend recommended these diapers when I was pregnant with my daughter. We've been buying them for the last 3 years and absolutely love them. She's never had a diaper rash with these, I love the wetness indicator, they are incredibly soft against her delicate skin...very happy mama here. There were times when I ran out and didn't order more fast enough so we had to use some other store diapers and they didn't work as great as these. Other diapers have also irritated my daughters skin but that never happens with these diapers. I am so happy I came across these. Now if I can just get my daughter to potty train...
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Soft on bum. Absorbs well
customer_reviews.text: I love these bamboo diapers. I did use a bamboo diaper subscription but found these and tried them out. They are thick but baby can still move. And they absorb very well. We used them in a three hour flight and we had no leaks. Since switching to bamboo diapers baby has had no diaper rashes! And I really love how they don’t smell like diapers (if that makes sense) I also love how even in the bigger sizes they have a wetness indicator.
customer_reviews.author: racheldrymon

customer_reviews.title: super soft but tend to come apart
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are super soft. However, they are also super biodegradable...meaning that they sometimes unravel while your child is still wearing them. I regularly find chunks of cotton sticking to my baby's bottom and have even found these to come apart on the outside after my toddler has been crawling around. I also find that they wake my baby up at night when her diaper is wet because they feel quite wet on the skin. I'll continue to buy them as a secondary brand, for wearing during the day, but will have to stick with another brand for naps/overnight wear.
customer_reviews.author: mjsmjs

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers for us!
customer_reviews.text: Best diapers that I've found. We cloth diaper, but use these at night and while traveling. I always cover it with a cloth diaper cover and have never had leakage while doing that. They absorb so much urine and don't cause any rashes. We also love that they are more sustainable than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: CEisenfe

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I am completely shocked at how wonderful these diapers are. They meet every single need. I love that they have an indicator-saves time when checking if baby need to changed. No bad smell to them. I have noticed with other natural diapers that they are usually thin with a papery feel and tend to run small. These do NOT. They are nice and thick like "regular" diapers and are extremely soft-feel like cotton. And I would say they run a little bit big not small in the slightest. I won't be going back to any other brand! Just wish Amazon would add this to subscribe and save!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Way too big for newborn
customer_reviews.text: The small says for 6-16lbs, but my 6lb 12oz daughter was swallowed by these. She is now a month old, just over 8lbs, and transitioning out of N diapers to size 1 and still cannot wear them. I’m keeping until she gets bigger but the sizing is wayyyy off.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - diapers leak
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love these diapers. The idea and story is great - who doesn’t want eco friendly diapers that are chemical free? However, I should have listened to the other reviews. Upon unpacking, these had a weird chemically smell. To make matters worse, every time my newborn uses the bathroom, they leak through to the point of setting her outfit. She’s 3 weeks old and doesn’t produce much waste each time around so I’m shocked this is an issue. I bought 2 boxes - such a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Krupski

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper ever
customer_reviews.text: Best diapers ever! They run slightly larger than other diapers but they’re soft, absorbent, don’t cause diapers rash and we haven’t had one blowout vs with bambo where I can guarantee a blowout if baby pops in a diaper she has already peed in. I just wish they came in a case and weren’t twice the price of bambo diapers.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGardener

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVORITE
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 6 lb 13 oz newborn baby and hated them. BUT now my baby is 6 weeks old, 10 lbs. And I absolutely love these. There were leaks when she was smaller, but now they fit perfectly and are way softer than any other brand. I have tried pampers, huggies, luvs, babyganics, and parents choice. These are my favorite, though. And they don’t smell like ammonia when she pees. Has no smell when clean either, unlike the others. Now these will be the only diapers we use. Also fit better than the other diapers because they cover more area and fasten more securely.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed to find these diapers to be sooo soft and ...
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed to find these diapers to be sooo soft and absorbent! And I feel better using them every once in a while (complement to cloth) because they have little plastic (like normal disposables which traditionally take 450 years to break down) and are made primarily of bambu, a biodegradable primary material. As far as minuses, you can start to feel moisture when they are very full, but of course, that is important to avoid letting baby sit in his own pee for too long. Great product! Thanks, Andy Pandy!
customer_reviews.author: GeoSurf

customer_reviews.title: Soft and smells great
customer_reviews.text: After trying pampers, amazon, and huggies, we were thrilled to find these. They are the softest and nicest feeling diapers that preform just as well as pampers (but feels and smells so much better). I really wanted to find a more ecological diaper solution and so happy that I have these a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: We loved the feel of the material but these were SO BIG for “newborn” diapers our baby couldn’t wear them till she was over 10lbs. We went with Seventh Generation newborn diapers for the first few weeks and then used our Andy Pandy and now we use Amazon Basics diapers which are gentle and non toxic on our babies precious bum :)
customer_reviews.author: Crunchymama

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I found these diapers. They work great and I feel better knowing they’re better for the planet and my toddler. We used to buy Honest Brand and 7th Gen (which are great) but I feel better using these. My daughter is 2 and weighs 29 pounds and we purchased the XL. I might try a L next time to see if we can get the leg holes more snug. But no leaks and she seems comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper, not a great fit.
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, I love these diapers. I love how natural and absorbant they are, and I'm glad that they have newborn sizes now because their size smalls are sooo big. The wetness indicator is wonderful as well! I'm knocking off a star for fit. My son is currently 11 lbs, and he just swims in the size smalls. I bought some of the newborn sizes, but these just fit awkwardly. They are super tight around his legs and really big around the waist. I can't seem to cinch them on in a way that they fit him, and have had quite a few blow-outs up the back with them.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Juart

customer_reviews.title: Great cloth alternative for travel
customer_reviews.text: We use cloth diaper regularly but wanted to use a disposable for a long trip. These worked great. They feel really thin when you unpack them, but they a great job with absorbency. We didn't have any leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea and eco friendliness
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea and eco friendliness. However, seems to let moisture through, babies clothes where the diaper was always seemed damp. I'm not sure if this product really wisks moisture away either because baby was always upset if diaper was slightly wet. That's a heck of a lot of diapers if I'm changing each one with the first sign of urine. Maybe for potty training? Makes baby uncomfortable when she feels wet? I liked the feel and fit but just not for us:/
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love these but just can't unless the shape and sizes ...
customer_reviews.text: The material is soft and pure, but slightly on the thin side. The shape is very awkward(large rectangle) and does not fit on a baby snugly at all. For a 7+lb baby, my baby's legs were spread too far apart because of the wide rectangular shape. They also kept falling off and caused many leaky accidents. I really wanted to love these but just can't unless the shape and sizes are more ergonomic and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: DHJ

customer_reviews.title: He had a constant terrible rash from all the other brands we have tried
customer_reviews.text: I only wish I had bought these sooner for my one and a half year old. He had a constant terrible rash from all the other brands we have tried...finally I splurged on these and now a week later he no longer has any rash and has been rash free for days. It truly is a blessing and we are so grateful to have these diapers available. They feel almost like cloth diapers and work very well, no leaks...thank you! I wish they could be on subscribe and save.
customer_reviews.author: Klair

customer_reviews.title: Better than Huggies and Pampers!
customer_reviews.text: We received packages of Huggies and Pampers diapers as gifts when we were expecting our baby. We were satisfied with their quality, but we really wanted to find a more earth-friendly diaper to use. I was a little nervous about trying an unfamiliar brand, suspecting that quality might not be great...but these diapers REALLY IMPRESSED us. Very absorbent, no leaks, fits our baby well, and seems very comfortable. These diapers are absolutely superior to Huggies, Pampers, and the other brands of diapers we received. I just wish they were eligible for Subscribe and Save and/or the Amazon Mom diaper discount. Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Berg

customer_reviews.title: Very bad diapers!
customer_reviews.text: This are very bad diapers. My baby is always wet on the back with this diapers . This are also very big diapers for small size! The quality is low . I do not recommend this diapers for any babies!
customer_reviews.author: Marina Camenschi

customer_reviews.title: Good ingredients, no leak proof at all
customer_reviews.text: Liked the ingredients but I really wanted something my baby could use all night and not leak. These leaked every night so I just used them during the day for shorter amounts of time
customer_reviews.author: Dj

customer_reviews.title: Softest, most durable diapers we have found!
customer_reviews.text: These diapers have been great! I have been ordering them since my daughter was born and she is now 10 months. I recently had the experience to relate them to another shelf-bought product due to my lack of planning and we were amazed how much better the quality is and how long they can withstand and 11-12 our sleep cycle. These are made from the softest material, have a wonderful 'wet indicator' and are eco-friendly. Not to mention my little girl has yet to have any kind of diaper rash. In relation to other products on the market, they are also pretty comparable in price. I recommend them to all the new moms out there!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Skeptic turned fan!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I'm super impressed with these. Arrived today, switching from Pampers Pure because my kiddo was still allergic to the edges of those. I don't have a verdict about allergies to these yet, but I CAN say they are SOFTER than the most popular brand diapers, they held up to a massive BM my kiddo took 10 minutes into wearing one, and I feel so much better using a biodegradable diaper now!
customer_reviews.author: Francine Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We love these diapers. My baby has eczema and this diaper does not cause my baby to break out. My only issue with these diapers is the absorbency could be improved if using overnight. We use a diaper pad in a addition to the diaper. It seems the 160 count for size medium is out of stock and they are charging the same amount I paid for the 160 count for the 80 count. We are truly disappointed as now we have to look for another brand of diaper. We refused to be ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Slimsunshine

customer_reviews.title: Great at containing poos, but they degrade quickly with urine
customer_reviews.text: I use these diapers for daytime use, but they are unfortunately not great for overnight use. They are great for containing poos, but when I used them overnight with my babe they became sopping wet inside and out. Overall a good natural choice for daytime diaper use, though.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Parent

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these diapers for my baby. She had a diaper rash that just wouldn't stop for over a month. Our pediatrician recommended these, and the rash cleared up so quickly! They do tend to go into "thong" position easier than some big brand diapers, but I would still recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: The best disposables I have used
customer_reviews.text: Been using these since my little one was a newborn. I did cloth diapers while on maternity leave but it was too much to handle while I’m back at work full time plus daycare requires that I use disposables. I feel better using these than other disposables (environmentally speaking) but they also work better than cloth! They are soooo absorbent. Work all night no problem. If baby doesn’t poop they can go hours without changing during the day and he’s still dry.
customer_reviews.author: cccamazon

customer_reviews.title: Best of the bamboo/natural diaper category
customer_reviews.text: These are the winner within the bamboo diaper category. Andy Pandys have been great diapers for my baby's sensitive skin since the day she was born! They are very soft & absorbent, fit well & don't leak through the legs. The only con is that the occasionally feel damp on the outside if left on for more than a couple hours. We still love them though. We tried the Bambo brand but they have the baby a very bad rash each time. The only other diaper we can use on her sensitive skin are Pampers Swaddlers for Sensitive Skin. Both are great products!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: We love Andy Pandy
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a spokesperson for Andy Pandy, but I feel like I could be. I recommend Andy Pandy whenever I can. Seriously, I didn't think I could love a diaper, but I do. My daughter has been wearing Andy Pandy for nearly 18 months now. We used a different brand at the hospital and Honest briefly when there was an Andy Pandy shortage. We have had ZERO blowouts. I am amazed at how much these diapers hold. The tabs also can be readjusted several times without losing stickiness. I would rate them higher than five star if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon L

customer_reviews.title: Nice but too big for newborn
customer_reviews.text: I like them but it isn't love. I bought them for my newborn but they are the same size as Huggies size 1 diapers so way too big for my little 8 pound baby. The diapers are super soft though and don't have any sort of smell to them. I also liked that they are plain white. We also didn't have any blow outs when we were finally able to use them. If the price was a little lower I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jill George

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage and fit...no rashes ever.
customer_reviews.text: Used these since about 8 weeks when our daughter was finally big enough to fit in smalls. We have been fortunate enough to have no diaper rashes at almost 8 months old. We use mainly warm wash cloths or sometimes water wipes, and Weleda diaper cream overnight or in the car seat. Only complaint is sometimes after a long night they feel damp outside but dont seem to pass moisture to clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor

customer_reviews.title: Quality went down
customer_reviews.text: I used to like these and my son used to be a bit small for the L size and now they fit just right and I really don’t know what happened but they just soak through in about 2 hours. I used to be able to have them in him overnight and he will be fine - now I don’t know whether they have changed something, the quality is not the same with the last two bags I bought. The outside is wet after two hours, it’s not just leaking. Will definitely switch to something else after we go through these.
customer_reviews.author: Mariya Tatianina

customer_reviews.title: Overall great eco friendly diaper
customer_reviews.text: I think these are really great diapers. I love everything about them: eco friendly, wetness indicator, no chemicals, etc. The only thing that disappoints is their use as an overnight diaper. I have noticed that I have to change my daughters diaper at every night feeding (3x) because if I don't, the diaper will get soaked and her clothes will get wet. Some other brands seem to do better at night but I love these diapers overall. I wish they made an overnight diaper that would hold up a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley G

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love these diapers. We use cloth diapers but when our babe was a newborn we used these and I loved how soft they were and had great absorbency! It's nice knowing you are putting something safe on your babes skin and not something full of chemicals. Plus they are more earth friendly. Still use these over night and they last all night without a change!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are, hands down, the best! They are so soft and absorbent! My son is allergic to all of the commercially made diapers and all of his issues went away with these! We never had a leak or a single rash, thank you Andy Pandy!! We are moving on to training pants now, my only regret is not finding these sooner and saving my son all of the pain and itching of the hives and rashes from the other brands!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy2Rider

customer_reviews.title: I really like these but they do leak quite often
customer_reviews.text: These are the only diapers (other than seventh generation) that do not give my baby a diaper rash. Seventh generation are rough and have less absorbency though (and they don’t have a wetness indicator). I really like these but they do leak quite often. My baby is on the skinny side so I’m not sure if that’s why. I’m hoping when she gets bigger they’ll fit her better.
customer_reviews.author: Jill M.

customer_reviews.title: Better than pampers and better for environment
customer_reviews.text: We've tried about 5 diaper brands and we have few leaks with these even going 12 hrs overnight. Sometimes we cover these with a cloth diaper cover if we are concerned about leaking. We use cloth diapers and disposible at night. We were wanting to change to a more sustainable disposible diaper which was how we came upon these. I would love to see a study that shows just how environmentally friendly these are.
customer_reviews.author: Anna E

product_meta.title: Eco Friendly Premium Bamboo Disposable Diapers by Andy Pandy - XL - for Babies Weighing 26+ lbs - X-Large (Pack of 62)
feature_bullets: The package dimension of the product is 17"L x 12.7"W x 5.3"H
The package weight of the product is 6.2 pounds
Country of origin is United States

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
